name: beneath
posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense.name: beneath
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in or to a lower position than someone or something, under someone or something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在（或往）…下面；在（或往）…下方

example.eg: Jaime hid the letter beneath a pile of papers.
example.egtrans: 海梅把信藏在一叠文件下面。

example.eg: We huddled together for warmth beneath the blankets.
example.egtrans: 我们裹着毛毯挤在一起取暖。

example.eg: After weeks at sea, it was wonderful to feel firm ground beneath our feet once more.
example.egtrans: 在海上呆了几星期之后，脚下再次接触坚实土地的感觉真棒。

example.eg: Emma was so tired and hungry that her legs were beginning to give way beneath her (= she was about to fall over).
example.egtrans: 埃玛又累又饿，双腿已经开始发软了。

dsense.name: beneath
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not be good enough for someone

example.eg: Office work of any description he felt was beneath him.
example.egtrans: 他觉得做任何办公室的工作都有失他的身份。

name: beneath
posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

example.eg: She looked out of the window at the children playing beneath.
example.egtrans: 她透过窗户看着孩子们在下面玩耍。
